snippet: While Google remains the dominant search engine, its grasp on the mobile market is slipping in the face of increased competition from “native” applications designed for pocket-size devices.
abstract: Google will add whether a website is mobile friendly to around 200 factors it uses to list websites on its search engine, which could result in many sites experiencing downgrade in their rankings from Google searches.
lead_paragraph: While Google remains the dominant search engine, its grasp on the mobile market is slipping in the face of increased competition from “native” applications designed for pocket-size devices.

headline.main: Google Adds ‘Mobile Friendliness’ to Its Search Criteria
headline.print_headline: Google Adds ‘Mobile Friendliness’ to Its Search Criteria
